title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 February 2016 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
05:12 <benoitc> has quit  
05:18 <benoitc> has joined #xwiki  
05:19 <tillo> has quit  
05:19 <lynxt> has quit  
05:19 <Inge-> has quit  
05:20 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
05:21 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
05:21 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki

08:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <cjd\_> has quit  
08:38 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:41 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:11 <vmassol> good morning  
09:11 <vmassol> let's try to release 7.4.1 and/or 8.0M1 today! :)  
09:12 <vmassol> fixing my issues missing documentation ATM  
09:16 <tmortagne> I think Enygma still have a few things to finish  
09:17 <tmortagne> we also have XRENDERING-428 assigned to noone  
09:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: didn't you started working on it at some point ?  
09:19 <vmassol> tmortagne: no I didn't start, I reported it and wanted to look at it but didn't get to do it  
09:19 <vmassol> I'm not sure it's critical  
09:20 <vmassol> because using path: with querystring is not an obvious use case  
09:20 <vmassol> oh sorry yes I did start to investigate  
09:20 <vmassol> (just noticed my comment)  
09:20 <vmassol> but very quickly  
09:20 <vmassol> jsut to find out that it's the html cleaner  
09:20 <vmassol> that is the issue  
09:21 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <vmassol> but the htmlcleaner is correct  
09:21 <tmortagne> vmassol: but you associated it to 7.4.1 so is it blocker for 7.4.1 or should we move it ?  
09:21 <vmassol> IMO this issue can wait  
09:21 <vmassol> it's not a blocker IMO  
09:21 <vmassol> we can move it  
09:22 <vmassol> I'm moving it  
09:22 <vmassol> done  
09:22 <tmortagne> does it need any "fix fox" ?  
09:22 <vmassol> I kept 8.0M2 only  
09:22 <vmassol> but that's not even sure  
09:22 <vmassol> we can remove it  
09:22 <tmortagne> if it's not too critical I would remove it  
09:22 <vmassol> ok go ahead  
09:23 <vmassol> I hope the issue doesn't arise in other cirucmsntances  
09:23 <vmassol> here with path: it's not a big deal  
09:23 <tmortagne> especially since it's pretty useless in path context  
09:23 <vmassol> sure but it's not just querystring  
09:23 <vmassol> it's any param  
09:24 <vmassol> (I guess)  
09:25 <tmortagne> re you webdav commit, if you plan to add webdav in extensions.xwiki.org you should probably cherry-pick this in 7.4 branch as otherwise you won't get this until 8.0 final is out  
09:27 <tmortagne> ( vmassol )  
09:27 <vmassol> yes good idea  
09:29 <vmassol> it's a pity BTW that I'm loosing the history of http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/WebDAV#Attachments  
09:37 <tmortagne> I don't understand what you mean  
09:38 <tmortagne> why do you loose the history of http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/WebDAV#Attachments ?  
09:38 <tmortagne> you mean because you are going to move the documentation to exo ?  
09:38 <vmassol> because I crated the new page using import  
09:38 <vmassol> \*created  
09:38 <vmassol> and I can't merge the history  
09:38 <vmassol> so I'm copying the content  
09:39 <vmassol> I guess I could do an include and change the content a bit  
09:39 <vmassol> but not very nice  
09:39 <tmortagne> then delete the page you just created and or copy http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/WebDAV#Attachments to exo instead  
09:39 <tmortagne> \*move or copy  
09:40 <vmassol> yes but it's a lot of work for not much  
09:40 <vmassol> I'd rather do an include if you think it's important to keep the content  
09:40 <vmassol> \*history  
09:40 <tmortagne> you don't have to delete the old page  
09:40 <tmortagne> you can simply empty it and link to the new doc  
09:40 <vmassol> yes ok I can do a redirect  
09:40 <vmassol> good idea  
09:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: "if you think it's important to keep the content" you're the one complaining about the history lost :)  
09:41 <vmassol> I know, I'm not sure  
09:41 <vmassol> anyway the redirect works  
09:41 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:42 <vmassol> haha merge conflict :)  
09:42 <vmassol> a small one...  
09:47 <fcharton> has quit  
09:50 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: only issue is that the doc says it's not bundled by default, etc which isn't true for 7.4 but ok...  
10:12 <tmortagne> the doc is not versionned, it's the same issue for the whole xwiki.org  
10:12 <vmassol> sure bit users will see download/install 7.4 with wrong doc  
10:12 <vmassol> which is not the case for other parts  
10:12 <vmassol> but it's probably acceptable  
10:13 <tmortagne> right now 8.0 is not released so logically you should indicate that webdav is embedded  
10:13 <vmassol> btw I had forgotten we had https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-foxwiki ;)  
10:13 <vmassol> tmortagne: that's my point  
10:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> I'm not going to redo the doc so I'll leave it like this  
10:13 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <vmassol> re foxwiki we should check if it still works...  
10:14 <tmortagne> eve if it works you can't install it I think  
10:14 <tmortagne> since you need to regularly update the supported versions tag  
10:15 <tmortagne> anyway since the skin changed a lot since the last time foxwiki was touched there is not much change it's working  
10:16 <tmortagne> vmassol: according to jenkins tests are broken since https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/0f8c3308bf34a37057ed840086d4e4f4f6463da2  
10:17 <tmortagne> but did not digged much more yet  
10:17 <vmassol> tmortagne: I've pushed another commit after  
10:17 <vmassol> since this one was wrong  
10:17 <tmortagne> there has been another build after that but not better  
10:18 <tmortagne> trying to force XE rebuild  
10:18 <vmassol> k  
10:19 <tmortagne> started a XE build, we'll se  
10:19 <tmortagne> see  
10:20 <tmortagne> are you sure you cherry-picked the fix ?  
10:20 <tmortagne> master is not failing but 7.4 is  
10:20 <tmortagne> forget that master is failing  
10:20 <tmortagne> since both master and 7.4 are failing I doubt it's a timing issue  
10:21 <tmortagne> maybe the fix was not enough or the test are expecting to find some now remove javascript variable or something  
10:21 <vmassol> it shouldn't change anything normally for firefox  
10:22 <vmassol> I've merged correctly on the 7.4.x branch, just checked  
10:23 <tmortagne> I checked and it's the only thing that has been committed on 7.4 yesterday so it's definitely the cause but need to find why now  
10:23 <vmassol> checking locally  
10:23 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <vmassol> TBH I tested my first fix  
10:23 <vmassol> which was not causing any problem  
10:23 <vmassol> but it was wrong so I fixed it  
10:23 <vmassol> but didn't recheck the fix  
10:23 <vmassol> cehcking now  
10:24 <vmassol> actually that's not true, I did rechek it  
10:24 <vmassol> checking again  
10:25 <vmassol> works locally  
10:25 <vmassol> now checking one of the failing test  
10:27 <tmortagne> looks like a critical peace of most AWM test has been broken  
10:27 <tmortagne> maybe it could not set some configuration  
10:28 <tmortagne> looks like saving takes forever for some reason and the wait condition fail with a timeout  
10:30 <vmassol> tmortagne: you have a link to a failing test I can debug locally.  
10:30 <vmassol> ?  
10:31 <tmortagne> you can pick one in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-7.4.x/lastBuild/testReport/  
10:31 <tmortagne> they all seems to fail for more or less the same reason  
10:31 <tmortagne> but looks like a distant side effect  
10:31 <tmortagne> so it's not clear for me what is the actually reason, the effect is that save takes too long  
10:32 <tmortagne> but only with AWM  
10:32 <tmortagne> maybe mflorea have an idea or already saw this in the past  
10:33 <vmassol> I can rperoduce locally  
10:34 <vmassol> it's the step2 of AWM which takes forever  
10:34 <vmassol> it says "Saving… 0%"  
10:34 <tmortagne> yes  
10:34 <mflorea> seems related to the actionButtons.js change  
10:36 <vmassol> mflorea: I'm debugging locally  
10:36 <vmassol> and the change works fine  
10:36 <vmassol> var isCustomForm = (this.form.action.indexOf("/preview/") >= 0);  
10:36 <vmassol> returns false as it should  
10:36 <mflorea> should be true for AWM  
10:37 <mflorea> it has a custom form  
10:37 <vmassol> there's no preview  
10:37 <vmassol> in the url  
10:37 <vmassol> the url I have is: "http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/edit/test/Code/testClass?wizard=true&editor…mplate=AppWithinMinutes.ClassTemplate&parent=test.WebHome&title=test+Class"  
10:37 <mflorea> it's the other way around  
10:37 <mflorea> custom form = no preview  
10:37 <vmassol> before we had = contains("/preview")  
10:38 <vmassol> so contains would return true if /preview/ was there  
10:38 <vmassol> I haven't changed that  
10:38 <vmassol> hmm maybe there was a not I missed  
10:38 <vmassol> checking  
10:38 <vmassol> ah yes  
10:38 <vmassol> my bad  
10:38 <vmassol> :)  
10:38 <mflorea> :)  
10:38 <vmassol> there was a not  
10:38 <vmassol> sorry  
10:38 <vmassol> fixing  
10:39 <vmassol> what's funny  
10:39 <vmassol> is that where were 3 checking this line when I made the change  
10:39 <vmassol> (at my computer desk)  
10:39 <vmassol> I asked for confirmaztion  
10:39 <mflorea> :)  
10:39 <vmassol> :)  
10:40 <tmortagne> that's the kind of think nobody ever see and why we need automated tests :)  
10:41 <vmassol> and of course on my manual test with the admin save button it was working fine…  
10:41 <vmassol> should be ok now  
10:46 <vmassol> FWIW I got the following console errors locally, related to solr: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/60f93a54e5289e50d529/raw/27bd08f61e653b17fe41a2a6b290b8783cb79304/gistfile1.txt  
10:46 <vmassol> loadXWikiDoc returning null apparently  
10:46 <vmassol> it could have happened while I was stopping xwiki though  
10:47 <vmassol> still not very nice  
10:47 <vmassol> anyway  
10:52 <vmassol> Note: I have contacted by email the guy who started http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Redmine+Issues+Macro to ask him what were his plans.  
10:52 <vmassol> waiting one more day before removing it  
10:58 <vmassol> hmm we're missing documentation about our Events in xwiki  
11:05 <evalica> sdumitriu: hi Sergiu - do you still have work to do for XWIKI-12947 and XCOMMONS-905 ?  
11:06 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <vmassol> good luck evalica….  
11:08 <cjd> at this hour he's either up really really early or he's drunk  
11:08 <gdelhumeau> hello  
11:08 <gdelhumeau> I had an internet failure this morning  
11:08 <evalica> :) I will close the issues when we start the release, he still has a bit of time  
11:09 <cjd> yeah, better than dragging him away from the wild party to make him try to write some code xD  
11:09 <vmassol> except he doesn't drink alcohol ;)  
11:10 <cjd> Ahh, I actually had some suspicion of that  
11:10 <cjd> good for him  
11:10 <cjd> can party a lot harder if you don't drink

12:05 <vmassol> please check it to verify if it's correct and if I haven't missed anything important  
12:08 <Denis> userful event and temporary bridge sounds badly, but good to see that documentation :)  
12:12 <vmassol> it's the reality though :)

14:04 <vmassol> moving the old svg plugin away into legacy  
14:11 <evalica> thanks sdumitriu  
14:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: re ubersectors, in the end did you move the old classes to leacy or you just removed them?  
14:28 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:55 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <sdumitriu> vmassol: They're still in place, just deprecated, and Clirr is still complaining about them (no binary compatibility)  
15:38 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hmm I don't see any clirr exclude in platform-core  
15:38 <vmassol> oops that's commons  
15:39 <vmassol> ok found them so it means backward comapt is broken  
15:39 <vmassol> IMO it's not often that users implement uberspectors so that could be acceptable  
15:40 <vmassol> however in this case, we could also decide to completely remove the classes instead of deprecating them  
15:40 <vmassol> (since backward compat is broken anyway)  
15:41 <vmassol> ah one point though  
15:41 <vmassol> users can have configured velocity uberspectors in their xwiki.properties  
15:41 <vmassol> does that continue to work? (did you test that use case?)  
15:42 <vmassol> so maybe:  
15:43 <vmassol> - users of existing uberspectors provided by XWiki are not broken, even when using the old velocity configuration for uberspectors  
15:43 <vmassol> - implementers of uberspectors will need to have their code recompiled against xwiki 8.0 (ie backward compat broken)  
15:43 <vmassol> is that correct?  
15:47 <tmortagne> vmassol: as far as I understand the old configuration does not work anymore, you can to change it when you upgrade  
15:47 <tmortagne> s/can to/have to/  
15:48 <vmassol> hmm that would be bad  
15:48 <vmassol> I guess I'll have to check this  
15:48 <vmassol> then  
15:48 <tmortagne> it's less bad for configuration than API and it's 8.0 but yes not so nice  
15:48 <vmassol> you can be sure that people will forget to update their config file  
15:48 <tmortagne> needs to be documented in the RN at least  
15:48 <vmassol> let me see what error they get  
15:48 <vmassol> and if thi sis true  
15:48 <vmassol> (it wasn't my understanding)  
15:49 <tmortagne> I think they will not get any error, simply it won't be taken into account  
15:49 <tmortagne> if they only modified runtime.introspector.uberspect.chainClasses  
15:50 <vmassol> I'm checking the typical use case of people who have removed the deprecatd uberspector  
15:50 <vmassol> (a typical use case that is even documented on xwiki.org)  
15:51 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+to+avoid+deprecated+messages+in+the+logs  
15:51 <tmortagne> yes runtime.introspector.uberspect.chainClasses  
15:54 <tmortagne> what I understand is that this property simply don't exist anymore from velocity point of view so unless velocity log error for unknown properties you won't know that it's not taken into account anymore  
15:55 <vmassol> ouch  
15:55 <vmassol> testing one more thing...  
15:56 <tmortagne> now you will quickly see that you have deprecated API warning in the log :)  
15:56 <tmortagne> so that's an indication :D  
15:56 <vmassol> yes  
15:56 <vmassol> what worries me a lot more  
15:56 <vmassol> is that you won't hae the secure uberspector nor the methodargument one  
15:56 <vmassol> and that's an issue  
15:57 <tmortagne> why ?  
15:57 <tmortagne> those are enabled by default  
15:57 <vmassol> because they'll be ignored  
15:57 <tmortagne> what is ignored in your customization  
15:57 <vmassol> not if you have configured the uberspectors  
15:57 <tmortagne> you get the default uberspectors  
15:57 <tmortagne> you have configured property that does not exist  
15:57 <tmortagne> so nobody cares  
15:58 <tmortagne> it's like commented stuff basically  
15:58 <vmassol> yes ok I get it  
15:58 <vmassol> should be ok  
15:58 <vmassol> still checking  
15:59 <vmassol> ok good  
16:06 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you have forgotten to update xwiki.properties.vm it seems  
16:07 <vmassol> fixing  
16:07 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
16:07 <tmortagne> vmassol: I saw a commit from sdumitriu updating it  
16:08 <vmassol> I don'(t have it locally  
16:08 <vmassol> and I don't see it in the commit tab  
16:08 <tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/cc0ce74acc684d4b2af317fb4b9928f9bbca5265  
16:08 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
16:08 <vmassol> ah my bad  
16:08 <tmortagne> that's the reason why the issue was still open  
16:08 <vmassol> I git pulled commons  
16:08 <vmassol> :)  
16:08 <vmassol> instead of platform  
16:09 <vmassol> but it's not in the issue's commit tab though...  
16:09 <tmortagne> yes I found that weird  
16:10 <vmassol> he's using [Misc]  
16:10 <vmassol> that's why  
16:10 <tmortagne> right  
16:10 <tmortagne> did not checked  
16:10 <vmassol> too bad...  
16:10 <tmortagne> yep  
16:12 <tmortagne> I think we need a simpler option to enable/disabled logs which does not require to know so much about Velocity behavior  
16:13 <tmortagne> \*debug log  
16:13 <vmassol> we need a wiki console ASAP  
16:13 <tmortagne> (and is less fragile and could be used for other purpose than Velocity)  
16:14 <vmassol> to have the logs of page rendering in the wiki  
16:14 <vmassol> (at each page level)  
16:16 <tmortagne> [7.4.1] http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-7.4.x/60/testReport/ looks like a real thing  
16:16 <tmortagne> AWM again  
16:16 <tmortagne> but only one this time  
16:18 <tmortagne> looks like a test have a syntax error in a XPATH  
16:18 <tmortagne> "SyntaxError: The expression is not a legal expression." with //td[contains(@class, 'doc\_space')]/a[. = 'WizardTest » testCreateApplication » fZ;''`,UeWPâ']  
16:18 <tmortagne> vmassol, mflorea: right a bell ?  
16:19 <vmassol> doesn't wrong a bell  
16:20 <tmortagne> yeah ok s/right/ring/  
16:20 <vmassol> :)  
16:20 <mflorea> yes, it's not a real problem. I'm using a random string to test that you can put anything in the name of an app created with AWM so this can break some of the XPaths we use in tests because we don't properly escape  
16:20 <mflorea> I fixed some of the XPath but there are a few remaining  
16:20 <vmassol> I'd suggest to avoid random test inputs  
16:21 <vmassol> ok  
16:21 <mflorea> it did help me discover some characters that were causing issues  
16:21 <vmassol> it's actually nice to have random inputs but those tests need to be in a different category  
16:22 <vmassol> yes I agree there are some nice effects  
16:31 <msmeria> has quit  
17:45 <Denis> Hi guys, shouldn't we put a comment on this page http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/HTML+To+Wiki+Converter+Extension, in order to avoid user to think that you need perl to convert HTML to XWiki ?  
17:48 <vmassol> sure go ahead  
17:58 <vmassol> anyone know the config param in xwiki.cfg to not allow inactive users to access the wiki?  
17:59 <vmassol> is that xwiki.inactiveuser.allowedpages ?  
17:59 <vmassol> and by default no pages are allowed  
17:59 <vmassol> ?  
18:00 <vmassol> hmm I don't think so  
18:00 <vmassol> since it didn't work for me on 8.0-SNAPSHOT  
18:00 <vmassol> inactive users could access all pages  
18:25 <vmassol> hmm  
18:25 <vmassol> I can't get the images to refresh from the cache...  
18:25 <vmassol> I wonder if it's a CF-related issue  
18:25 <vmassol> probably  
18:26 <woshilapin> Utils.getComponent is deprecated?  What should I use to instantiate a component from a non-component class?  
18:27 <vmassol> woshilapin: yes  
18:27 <vmassol> you don't  
18:27 <vmassol> :)  
18:28 <vmassol> the component passes what's needed to the non-component  
18:28 <vmassol> (it can pass ComponenentManager too if need be)  
18:28 <vmassol> \*ComponentManager  
18:28 <woshilapin> mmm, I don't understand  
18:29 <woshilapin> I found that at a lot of place in xwiki-platform  
18:29 <woshilapin> EntityReferenceSerializer<String> serializer = Utils.getComponent(EntityReferenceSerializer.TYPE\_STRING)  
18:29 <vmassol> yes and that's bad  
18:29 <woshilapin> Which is exactly what I need but deprecated  
18:29 <woshilapin> So don't know what should be the correct syntax  
18:29 <vmassol> I told you  
18:30 <vmassol> the component passes what's needed to the non-component  
18:30 <woshilapin> pass ComponentManager is what I don't understand  
18:30 <vmassol> we don't support injection in non component classes ATM  
18:31 <woshilapin> Oh, you mean Utils can pass ComponentManager?  
18:31 <vmassol> so you need to pass to it what it needs  
18:31 <vmassol> standard IOC-way  
18:31 <vmassol> no  
18:31 <vmassol> let me give you an example
